testElement.specReference: Phrase elements: EM, STRONG, DFN, CODE, SAMP, KBD, VAR, CITE, ABBR, and ACRONYM

purpose.p: This test case is intended to pass because an expansion of the acronym is provided immediately before the acronym.

expertGuidance.p: Check whether an expansion of the acronym is available.

functionalOutcome.p: The user can find the expanded form of the acronym.

techComment.p: This test case is the same as sc3.1.4_l3_002, but the order of the acronym and the expanded form is reversed.
This test case maps to technique G97: Providing the abbreviation immediately following the expanded form.

functionalOutcome.p: The user can find the expanded form of the acronym.

techComment.p: This test case is the same as sc3.1.4_l3_002 (previously xhtml1_wcag2_20050630_3.1_l3_sc3_002), but the order of the acronym and the expanded form is reversed. The 23 November 2005 version of "Understanding WCAG 2.0 lists "providing the abbreviation immediately following the first use of the expanded form within the delivery unit" as a "sufficient technique". See http://www.w3.org/TR/2005/WD-UNDERSTANDING-WCAG20-20051123/#meaning-located.
